meanings.definition: People who have an irrational fear or aversion to computers.
meanings.sent1: Many computerphobes feel anxious when faced with a computer screen.
meanings.sent2: Some computerphobes prefer to use pen and paper instead of a computer.
meanings.sent3: The computerphobes in the office jokingly call themselves 'tech-challenged'.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of computers turned her into a computerphobe, avoiding all technology.
meanings.sent5: The image of a computerphobe trembling at the sight of a laptop is quite vivid.

meanings.definition: The fear or aversion to computers.
meanings.sent1: His computerphobes prevent him from embracing modern technology.
meanings.sent2: The computerphobes in the group always opt for traditional methods.
meanings.sent3: The computerphobes at the library refuse to use the computer terminals.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a computerphobe in a world filled with digital devices.
meanings.sent5: The computerphobes' avoidance of technology is quite noticeable in today's society.
